TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MediaStreamVideoTrackAttributes extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The MediaStreamVideoTrackAttributes allows setting of the MediaStreamVideoTrack configuration.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The maximum number of frames to hold in the input buffer. Note: this is only used as advisory; the browser may allocate more or fewer based on available resources.How many frames to buffer depends on usage - request at least 2 to make sure latency doesn't cause lost frames. If the plugin expects to hold on to more than one frame at a time(e.g.to do multi-frame processing), it should request that many more. If this attribute is not specified or value 0 is specified for this attribute, the default value will be used.

The format of video frames. The attribute value is a VideoFrameFormat. If the specified format is different from the video source (webcam), frames will be converted to specified format. If this attribute is not specified or value Unknown is specified, the orignal frame format of the video track will be used.

The height of video frames in pixels.It should be a multiple of 4. If the specified size is different from the video source(webcam), frames will be scaled to specified size. If this attribute is not specified or value 0 is specified, the original frame size of the video track will be used.
Maximum value: 4096 (4K resolution).

The width of video frames in pixels. It should be a multiple of 4. If the specified size is different from the video source (webcam), frames will be scaled to specified size. If this attribute is not specified or value 0 is specified, the original frame size of the video track will be used.
Maximum value: 4096 (4K resolution).
